item.title: Report E-2024070032
item.description:
Report E-2024070032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 21, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released paint in the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted freight and pallet with absorbent pads and degreaser. The spent absorbents and cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon bucket, and the one (1) 5-gallon pail of damaged product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070083
item.description:
Report X-2024070083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ROUND ROCK
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY SEVEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. OUTER BOX IS PREPRINTED PERISHABLE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING A UPS AIR SHIPPING DOCUMENT WITHOUT A UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER. SHIPPER AND CONSIGNEE ARE VERY FAINT BUT APPEAR TO BE SHIPPER: SCOTT DILLON, WORLD MKTG COMPANY, 1010 STILLHOUSE SPG, ROUND ROCK TX 78681, 512-992-9044. THE CONSIGNEE IS ALLEN SMITH, NATIVE AMERICAN ENTERPRISES, 1230 N. WEST ST, WICHITA KS 67203, 931-585-1481.

item.title: Report X-2024070078
item.description:
Report X-2024070078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT RESPONDER DISCOVERED DAMAGED AND LEAKING CARTON ON PALLET OUTSIDE DMP AREA, INSIDE TOTE. CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS CLEARLY VISIBLE, SO SHE DONNED PPE, INCLUDING SILVER SHIELD GLOVES, AND PROCEEDED TO NEUTRALIZE THE LEAKING ACID WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE. RESPONDER VERIFIED THAT THE SUBSTANCE WAS NEUTRALIZED USING PH TAPE. THE CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD, CLAY ABSORBANT, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THE ENTIRE AUTOMOTIVE BATTERY WAS PLACED INSIDE A GREEN BAG. MORE SODIUM BICARBONATE AND CLAY ABSORBANT WERE ADDED TO THE BAG IN ORDER TO CATCH ANY MORE ACID THAT MAY LEAK FROM THE BATTERY.

item.title: Report I-2024050079
item.description:
Report I-2024050079

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T00:36:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: Fort Worth
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Minibulk driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% to Cintas in Fort Worth, TX. Driver arrived on site and proceeded to the offloading location. Once at the offloading location the driver proceeded to make the delivery. During the end of the delivery approximately 7 gallons of Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% was released into containment.
